message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.ITP. 

The paper deals with the problem of locally decodable source coding, which involves encoding a source message into a compressed string that can be decoded by querying only a few bits of the compressed string. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), coding theory (cs.CC), signal processing (cs.SI), and information theory and coding (cs.ITP).
